message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to match and build the two structures exactly as shown, using only the orientations provided in the block‐dictionary image (no rotations allowed):

------------------------------------------------------------
1)  DETAILED ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
------------------------------------------------------------

●  Overall Count and Layers
   –  There are two separate “mini‐structures.”  
   –  The left structure uses 7 pieces stacked in 5 vertical layers.  
   –  The right structure uses 5 pieces stacked in 3 vertical layers.  
   –  In total, 12 blocks are used.

●  Left Structure (from bottom to top)
   Layer 1: A yellow rectangular block on the ground (wide enough to hold two cylinders).  
   Layer 2: Two upright orange cylinders side by side.  
   Layer 3: Another yellow rectangular block bridging across the two cylinders.  
   Layer 4: A red arch block (arch opening downward) set on top of that yellow block.  
   Layer 5: Two orange wedge blocks forming a triangular “roof” above the arch.

●  Right Structure (from bottom to top)
   Layer 1: A yellow rectangular block on the ground.  
   Layer 2: Three blocks side‐by‐side:  
       – Green rectangular block (left side)  
       – Red “circular‐window” block in the center  
       – Green rectangular block (right side)  
   Layer 3: Another yellow rectangular block across the top.

------------------------------------------------------------
2)  SELECTING DICTIONARY BLOCKS (MATCHED BY COLOR/ORIENTATION)
------------------------------------------------------------

Below is the exact block index (from the dictionary image) for each part:

●  LEFT STRUCTURE (7 blocks)
   1) Bottom Yellow Bar:  block #10  
   2) Orange Cylinder (left):  block #11  
   3) Orange Cylinder (right): block #11  (same block index used again)  
   4) Middle Yellow Bar:  block #10  
   5) Red Arch (arch underside facing front‐to‐back):  block #1  
   6) Orange Wedge (left side of roof):  block #14  
   7) Orange Wedge (right side of roof): block #15  

●  RIGHT STRUCTURE (5 blocks)
   8) Bottom Yellow Bar:  block #10  
   9) Left Green Vertical Block:  block #6  
   10) Red Circular “Window” Block (as shown, hole facing front): block #4  
   11) Right Green Vertical Block: block #6  
   12) Top Yellow Bar:    block #10  

------------------------------------------------------------
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INFERRED FROM THE TARGET
------------------------------------------------------------

{
   Step1:  Move block with index 10   // bottom yellow bar (left structure)
   Step2:  Move block with index 11   // first orange cylinder
   Step3:  Move block with index 11   // second orange cylinder
   Step4:  Move block with index 10   // yellow bar bridging the cylinders
   Step5:  Move block with index 1    // red arch on top
   Step6:  Move block with index 14   // left orange roof wedge
   Step7:  Move block with index 15   // right orange roof wedge

   // Now the right‐hand “window” structure
   Step8:  Move block with index 10   // bottom yellow bar (right structure)
   Step9:  Move block with index 6    // green block on left
   Step10: Move block with index 4    // red center block with circular hole
   Step11: Move block with index 6    // green block on right
   Step12: Move block with index 10   // top yellow bar
}

Following the above sequence with no rotations yields the arrangement seen in the target image.
